Reviews.Title: Same as lorex but at a discounted price
Reviews.Author: MRCHIRO "MRCHIRO"
Reviews.Content: I can't believe it. Rebadged and sold for 2-300$ more. You kidding me? I had a lorex that the harddrive died on. I didn't want to mess with it b/c it was hard to setup and you had to use lorex subdomains to point to your cable internet dynamic IP. Though it's a free service, they should allow you to choose your own (I've been using dyn.com for years).So... how are the lorex and kguard machines the same? Wait... They were both identical... Same unit, remote, same mouse, same color scheme, same inside hardware (had to remove Kguards cover to install a harddrive). I can't believe I spent 600$ on the first lorex unit (i'm ashamed). The only difference is on Kguard, they allow the use of  your own dns service (dyn.com) while lorex makes it mandatory for you to register with them and use their free dns services.Since my rant is out of the way. Same setup plug and play basically. I'll continue to buy Kguard b/c it's cheaper and same units as the more expensive lorex units. If you have the cams already and just need the unit, buy this! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Samuel Cintron
Reviews.Content: The ABSOLUTE best DVR for home security I've ever used.  Clear easy to follow instructions, if you need them at all.  I tried Zmodo and hated it, for the same money this baby rocks.

Reviews.Title: try something else
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: The KGuard Security DVR with 4 cameras has plenty of nice features. Everything seems to work well except for one fatal flaw. On playback of the recorded video, particularly at 16x speed, one or more of the video channels will just go black. Pressing play, or reverse will bring the video back, so the camera feed is recorded fine, but it is annoying to have various video channels going black during playback.
